# Kigali Sim
v=20260224

Open source web-based simulation engine for Montreal Protocol policy modeling. It is **strongly** recommended to review [llms-full.txt](llms-full.txt) which can be found at http://kigalisim.org/llms-full.txt.

## Resources

- [Full Documentation](llms-full.txt) - Comprehensive KigaliSim documentation including QubecTalk language specification
- [Tutorial Series](guide/md/index.md) - Step-by-step tutorials for policy simulation modeling
- [Getting Started](guide/md/tutorial_01.md) - Basic introduction to KigaliSim interface and concepts
- [QubecTalk Language](guide/md/qubectalk_commands.md) - Domain-specific language command reference
- [QubecTalk Language Features](guide/md/qubectalk_language_features.md) - Advanced programming constructs and features
- [QubecTalk Program Structure](guide/md/qubectalk_stanzas.md) - Stanza organization and simulation structure
- [Policy Modeling](guide/md/tutorial_07.md) - Advanced policy intervention techniques using code-based interface
- [Equipment Units-Based Modeling](guide/md/tutorial_08.md) - Alternative consumption specification using equipment sales data
- [GWP Analysis](guide/md/tutorial_09.md) - Global warming potential refrigerant comparison analysis
- [AI Coding Assistants](guide/md/tutorial_11.md) - Using AI assistants to help build or modify simulations through code
- [Getting Help](guide/md/get_help.md) - Support resources and troubleshooting guides

## Tutorial Series Overview

**Introduction (1):** HFC background and Kigali Sim basics
- [Tutorial 1](guide/md/tutorial_01.md) - Introduction to Kigali Sim: Understanding HFCs

**UI-based Authoring (2-6a):** Point-and-click simulation building
- [Tutorial 2](guide/md/tutorial_02.md) - Single Application and Substance
- [Tutorial 3](guide/md/tutorial_03.md) - Multiple Applications and Substances
- [Tutorial 3a](guide/md/tutorial_03a.md) - Multiple Substances with AI
- [Tutorial 4](guide/md/tutorial_04.md) - Growth and Trade
- [Tutorial 4a](guide/md/tutorial_04a.md) - Growth and Trade with AI
- [Tutorial 5](guide/md/tutorial_05.md) - Simple Policies
- [Tutorial 6](guide/md/tutorial_06.md) - Recycling
- [Tutorial 6a](guide/md/tutorial_06a.md) - Recycling with AI

**Code-based Authoring (7-8):** QubecTalk programming
- [Tutorial 7](guide/md/tutorial_07.md) - First Code: QubecTalk and multi-substance recycling
- [Tutorial 8](guide/md/tutorial_08.md) - Equipment Units-Based Modeling

**Modeling Co-benefits (9-10):** Environmental and energy impact
- [Tutorial 9](guide/md/tutorial_09.md) - Global Warming Potential
- [Tutorial 10](guide/md/tutorial_10.md) - Equipment Energy Efficiency

**Artificial Intelligence (11):** AI-assisted coding
- [Tutorial 11](guide/md/tutorial_11.md) - AI Coding Assistants

**Advanced Modeling (12-17):** Bank tracking, variable hazards, exports
- [Tutorial 12](guide/md/tutorial_12.md) - Advanced Sales Assumptions
- [Tutorial 13](guide/md/tutorial_13.md) - Assumed Replacement
- [Tutorial 14](guide/md/tutorial_14.md) - Bank-Based Modeling
- [Tutorial 15](guide/md/tutorial_15.md) - Variable Retirement and Servicing
- [Tutorial 16](guide/md/tutorial_16.md) - Command Line and Monte Carlo Analysis
- [Tutorial 17](guide/md/tutorial_17.md) - Exports

## Key Capabilities

**Substance Modeling:** HFCs, HCFCs, and alternative refrigerants with Global Warming Potential (GWP) values and automatic unit conversions

**Application Modeling:** Equipment types including domestic refrigeration, commercial refrigeration, residential AC, mobile AC with lifecycle management

**Policy Simulation:** Import restrictions, manufacturing caps, substance phase-outs, recycling requirements, and regulatory scenario modeling

**Business Scenarios:** Manufacturing, imports, equipment lifecycles, service activities, energy consumption with probabilistic projections

**QubecTalk DSL:** Human-readable domain-specific language for simulation definition with natural language constructs and automated calculations

**Web Interface:** Browser-based tool with Basic (UI) and Advanced (code) editing modes, no server-side computation required
